sn4.11:1.1: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Rājagaha on Mount Vulture Peak.
sn4.11:1.2: Now on that occasion the Blessed One was sitting out in the open in the thick darkness of the night while it was drizzling.
sn4.11:1.3: Then Māra the Evil One, wishing to arouse fear, trepidation, and terror in the Blessed One, shattered a number of huge boulders not far away from him.
sn4.11:2.1: Then the Blessed One, having understood, “This is Māra the Evil One, ” addressed Māra the Evil One in verse:
sn4.11:3.1: “Even if, all over in its entirety,
sn4.11:3.2: you make this Vulture Peak quake,
sn4.11:4.1: Then Māra the Evil One, realizing, “The Blessed One knows me, the Fortunate One knows me, ” sad and disappointed, disappeared right there.
